cmCourseInfo.description: Infants’ abilities at birth, prelinguistic development, the first words, phonological, syntactic and semantic development. Social variables influencing language acquisition, bilingualism, models of development, language play. (Sponsored by the Departments of Linguistics and Psychology, but administered solely by the Dept. of Linguistics).
cmCourseInfo.title: Language Acquisition
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: One full course equivalent at the 200+-level in LIN/JAL/JUP/PSL/PSY/COG

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Lectures will be delivered online per the meeting schedule. Lecture recordings will be made available online for students to review. Students will also be expected to view video content prior to class meetings. Students will have the opportunity for weekly online office hours. It is recommended that students have a device with a microphone and camera in order to participate in online activities.

cmCourseInfo.description: In Psychology of Language, we investigate human and other animal communication, structure of human language, word meaning and semantic memory, psychological studies of syntax, bilingualism, language and thought, language errors and disorders. (Sponsored by the Departments of Linguistics and Psychology, but administered solely by the Dept. of Linguistics).
cmCourseInfo.title: Psychology of Language
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: One FCE from LIN228H1, LIN229H1, LIN232H1, LIN241H1, PSY260H1, PSY270H1, PSY280H1, PSY290H1, COG250Y1

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Lectures will be delivered online per the meeting schedule. Students need the ability to use BB Collaborate, and will be expected to be able to participate orally as well as through the chat and the Quercus discussion board.

cmCourseInfo.description: Seminar in advanced topics in psycholinguistics. Content varies from year to year. (Sponsored by the Departments of Linguistics and Psychology, but administered solely by the Dept. of Linguisitics).
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Psycholinguistics

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

As this is a seminar, class will take place per the meeting schedule (i.e., synchronously), and no recordings will be available. To participate in class activities, students need the ability to use Zoom, and will be expected to participate in both written and spoken discussion (i.e., a working microphone is required, video is highly recommended). To prepare for class, students will be expected to read any assigned readings and/or watch assigned videos and/or participate in discussion on Quercus.
